dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is not planning to introduce fines for airline passengers who stand up immediately after landing, the Ministry of Transport said, following reports that Turkey will begin penalizing such behavior.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so no new penalties there. But they did emphasize that current rules already prohibit standing during taxiing or landing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so no new penalties there. But they did emphasize that current rules already prohibit standing during taxiing or landing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a comment to Tengrinews.kz, the ministry stated that while new penalties are not being considered, current aviation rules already prohibit passengers from standing or walking during taxiing, takeoff, and landing, in line with international civil aviation standards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and if you ignore the crew's instructions, the captain can actually document the incident—and airport police might even get involved.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If a person on board violates these rules or disobeys orders from the captain or crew members, the captain has the right to take action, including documenting the incident.
